21.verse: “Sword! Slash to the right; destroy to the left, whichever way your edge is aimed!

22.verse: I too will clap my hands together and satisfy my fury. I, ADONAI, have spoken.”

23.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

24.verse: “Now, human being, designate two roads for the sword of the king of Bavel to follow, both coming out of one country. Put up a signpost at the start of the road leading to the city.

25.verse: Make a road, so that the sword can come to Rabbah of the people of ‘Amon and to Y’hudah in fortified Yerushalayim.

26.verse: For the king of Bavel is standing at the fork in the road, where the two roads separate, about to use divination — he is shaking the arrows, consulting the household gods, examining the liver.

27.verse: Into his right hand comes the lot for Yerushalayim, to set up battering rams, give the order for slaughter, raise a shout, set battering rams against the gates, build siege ramps and erect watchtowers.

28.verse: The inhabitants will believe this is a false divination because of the oaths upon oaths [that their false prophets have sworn to the contrary]. But it will cause [God] to remember their guilt and thus insure their capture.

29.verse: “Therefore this is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Because you have caused your guilt to be remembered, with your misdeeds revealed and the sins in all your actions evident — since you have been remembered, you will be captured.’

30.verse: As for you, you wicked prince of Isra’el, due to be killed, whose day has come, at the time of final punishment,

31.verse: here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Remove the turban, take off the crown! Everything is being changed. What was low will be raised up, and what was high will be brought down.

32.verse: Ruin! Ruin! I will leave it a ruin such as there has never been, and it will stay that way until the rightful ruler comes, and I give it to him.’

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Now, human being, are you prepared to judge? Are you prepared to judge the city drenched in blood? Then make her realize how disgusting all her practices are!

3.verse: Say that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘City that sheds blood within yourself, thus speeding your own doom, and that makes idols for yourself that defile you:

4.verse: you are guilty because of the blood you have shed, you are defiled by your idols that you have made. You have shortened your days, you have completed your years; therefore I have made you an object of scorn for the nations and a laughingstock for every country.

5.verse: Those close by and those far off will taunt you, you who have such a defiled reputation and such great disorder.

6.verse: “‘The leaders of Isra’el in you all use their power in order to shed blood.

7.verse: In you, they make light of fathers and mothers, they oppress foreigners, they wrong orphans and widows.

8.verse: You treat my holy things with contempt, you profane my shabbats.

9.verse: In you, people gossip to the point of inciting bloodshed; in you are those who go to eat on the mountains; in you, they commit lewd acts;

10.verse: in you, they commit incest; in you, they force themselves on women during their menstrual impurity.

11.verse: In you, one commits an abomination with his neighbor’s wife; another commits some lewd act defiling his daughter-in-law; still another humbles his sister, his own father’s daughter.

12.verse: In you, people take bribes to shed blood; you demand and accept interest on loans; in greed you make profits off your neighbors by extorting them; and you have forgotten me,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

13.verse: “‘Therefore, I am clapping my hands together because of your ill-gotten gains and the blood shed in you.

14.verse: Can your courage last, can your strength continue during the days when I deal with you? I, ADONAI, have spoken it; and I will do it.

15.verse: I will scatter you among the Goyim and disperse you throughout the countries; thus I will remove your defilement from you,

16.verse: and you will cause yourselves to be profaned in full view of the Goyim. Then you will know that I am ADONAI.’”

17.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

18.verse: “Human being, the house of Isra’el has become an alloy of base metals for me; they are all copper, tin, iron and lead mixed together in the crucible, the dross left over from the silver.

19.verse: Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘Because you have all become dross, I will collect all of you inside Yerushalayim.

20.verse: Then, just as they collect silver, copper, iron, lead and tin into a crucible and blow fire on it to melt it down; so likewise I will collect you in my anger and fury, throw you in there, and melt you down.

21.verse: Yes, I will collect you and blow on you with the fire of my rage, and you will be melted down in it.

22.verse: As silver is melted down in a crucible, so will you be melted down in [Yerushalayim]. Then you will know that it is I, ADONAI, who have poured out my fury on you.’”

23.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

24.verse: “Human being, tell her this: ‘You are a land that is neither cleansed nor rained on in the day of fury.

25.verse: There is a conspiracy of prophets in it like a roaring lion tearing up the prey; they have devoured people, seized wealth and valuables, and widowed many in it.

26.verse: Her cohanim have done violence to my Torah, profaned my holy things, made no difference between the holy and the common, not distinguished between unclean and clean, hidden their eyes from my shabbats, and profaned me among themselves.

27.verse: Her leaders in it are like wolves tearing up the prey to shed blood and destroy people, in order to benefit unjustly.

28.verse: Her prophets have “plastered” for them with whitewash, seeing false visions and divining lies for them, saying, “Thus says Adonai ELOHIM,” when ADONAI has not spoken.

29.verse: The people of the land have extorted, robbed, wronged the poor and needy and unjustly oppressed foreigners.

30.verse: “‘I sought for a man among them who could build a barricade or stand in the break to oppose me on behalf of the land, so that I would not destroy it; but I found no one.

31.verse: Therefore I am pouring out my fury on them, consuming them with the fire of my rage, bringing their own ways on their own heads,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being! There were two women, daughters of the same mother,

3.verse: who were whores in Egypt — even as young girls they were whores. There they let their breasts be caressed, and there their virgin nipples were fondled.

4.verse: Their names were Oholah, the older one, and Oholivah, her sister. They belonged to me, and they gave birth to sons and daughters. As for their names, Shomron is Oholah, and Yerushalayim is Oholivah.

5.verse: “Even when she belonged to me, Oholah prostituted herself; she lusted after her lovers from Ashur — warriors

6.verse: dressed in blue, governors, rulers, all of them good-looking young men riding on horseback.

7.verse: She gave herself as a whore to them, all of them the elite of Ashur; and she defiled herself with all the idols of everyone she lusted after.

8.verse: She did not give up the whoring she had begun in Egypt, where men had sex with her, fondled her virgin nipples and flooded her with their fornication.

9.verse: “So I handed her over to her lovers, the men of Ashur she lusted after.

10.verse: They exposed her private parts, took her sons and daughters, and put her to death with the sword; so that she became notorious among women for the judgments executed against her.

11.verse: “Her sister Oholivah saw this; nevertheless she was worse than her sister in lusting and likewise in whoring.

12.verse: She lusted after the men from Ashur, governors and rulers, warriors dressed to perfection, skilled horsemen, all of them good-looking young men.

13.verse: I saw that she had defiled herself; both sisters had gone down the same path.

14.verse: She prostituted herself more than ever; because she saw wall-carvings of men, depicting the Kasdim in vermilion,

15.verse: with sashes wrapped around their waists and flowing turbans on their heads, all of them looking like military men, the very image of men of Bavel born in the land of the Kasdim.

16.verse: The moment she saw them, she lusted after them and sent messengers to them in the land of the Kasdim;

17.verse: and the men of Bavel climbed into her “love bed” and defiled her with their lust. She was defiled by them, and then filled with revulsion at them.

18.verse: Thus did she reveal her fornication and expose her private parts. When this happened, I was filled with revulsion at her, just as I had been filled with revulsion at her sister.

19.verse: Still she kept increasing her whoring, remembering the days when she was young, fornicating in the land of Egypt.

20.verse: Yes, she lusted after their male prostitutes, whose members are like those of donkeys and who ejaculate like stallions.

21.verse: You yearned for the lewdness of your girlhood, when the Egyptians used to fondle your nipples and caress your young breasts.

22.verse: “Therefore, Oholivah, here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I will raise up your lovers against you, the ones who fill you with revulsion, and bring them against you from every side —

23.verse: the men of Bavel and all the Kasdim, P’kod, Shoa and Koa, and with them all the men of Ashur, good-looking young men, all of them governors and rulers, commanders and officers, all on horseback.

24.verse: They will advance on you armed with chariots, wagons and with an army drawn from many peoples; they will array themselves against you from every side with breastplates, shields and helmets. I will give them the authority to judge, and they will judge you as they see fit.

25.verse: I will direct my jealousy against you, so that they will deal with you in fury — they will cut off your nose and ears, and what is left of you will die by the sword; they will seize your sons and daughters, and those who remain of you will be consumed by the fire.

26.verse: They will strip you of your clothes and seize your fine jewels.

27.verse: Thus I will put an end to your lewdness and your fornication brought from the land of Egypt, so that you will no longer raise your eyes toward them or remember Egypt any more.’

28.verse: For this is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I am about to hand you over to those you hate, to those who fill you with revulsion;

29.verse: and they will deal with you in hatred, seize everything you have worked for, and leave you naked and exposed — the full shame of your whoring will be exposed, your lewdness and your fornicating.

30.verse: These things will be done to you because you have gone fornicating with the Goyim, and because you are defiled with their idols.

31.verse: You walked down your sister’s path, so I will put her cup in your hand.’

32.verse: Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘You will drink from your sister’s cup, a cup both deep and wide, full right up to the brim with scorn and derision,

33.verse: filling you with drunkenness and sorrow, a cup of horror and devastation — the cup of your sister Shomron.

34.verse: You will drink it, you will drain it, and then you will gnaw it to shreds and tear out your own breasts! For I have spoken it’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

35.verse: “Therefore this is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Because you forgot me and flung me behind your back, you will bear the guilt of your lewdness and whoring.’”

36.verse: Then ADONAI said to me, “Human being, are you ready to judge Oholah and Oholivah? Then confront them with their disgusting practices.

37.verse: For they committed adultery, and their hands are dripping with blood. They committed adultery with their idols; and they offered their sons, whom they bore to me, for these idols to eat.

38.verse: Moreover, they have done this to me as well: they defiled my sanctuary on the same day, and they profaned my shabbats.

39.verse: For after killing their children for their idols, they came the same day into my sanctuary to profane it; this they did in my house.

40.verse: “Worse still, you sent a messenger summoning men to come from a distance; and they came. For them you washed yourself, painted your eyes, decked yourself with your finery,

41.verse: and sat on a sumptuous bed, with a table arranged before it, on which you put my incense and my olive oil.

42.verse: The noise of a carefree crowd could be heard there; many of the men were brought in drunk from the desert. They put bracelets on their hands and magnificent crowns on their heads.

43.verse: I thought, ‘That woman! She’s worn out from all her adulteries, but they still go to fornicate with her!’

44.verse: For every one went in to her; just as men go in to a prostitute, so they went in to Oholah and Oholivah, those debauched women.

45.verse: Nevertheless, there are righteous men who will judge them as adulterers and murderers are supposed to be judged; because they are adulterers, and blood is dripping from their hands.

46.verse: For here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Summon an assembly to punish them; give them over to terror and plunder.

47.verse: Let the assembly stone them to death, dispatch them with their swords, kill their sons and daughters and burn their houses to the ground.

48.verse: “‘Thus I will put an end to lewdness in the land, so that all women may be taught not to imitate your lewdness.

49.verse: You will receive the punishment your lewdness deserves, and you will pay the penalty for your idolatries. Then you will know that I am Adonai ELOHIM.’”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me on the tenth day of the tenth month of the ninth year:

2.verse: “Human being, write down today’s date; because on this very day the king of Bavel has begun his attack on Yerushalayim.

3.verse: And tell this allegory to these rebels; say that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Put a pot on the fire; put it there, pour water in it;

4.verse: Put in it pieces of meat, all the best parts — the thigh, the shoulder; fill it with the choicest cuts,

5.verse: taken from the pick of the flock, and pile the bones underneath. Bring it to a rolling boil, till it’s all cooked, even the bones.’

6.verse: “Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Woe to the city drenched with blood, to the pot whose scum is in it, and whose scum has not been removed. Empty it piece by piece, without troubling to draw lots.

7.verse: For her blood is still in her; she poured it on bare rock; she did not pour it on the ground, to cover it with dust.

8.verse: So in order to rouse my fury and excite my vengeance, I have fixed her blood there on the bare rock, where it will not be covered.’

9.verse: “Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘Woe to the city drenched with blood! I myself will make a huge bonfire,

10.verse: heap on the wood, light it, cook the meat and add the spices — the bones can just be burned.

11.verse: Put the empty pot on the coals, heat it till its copper bottom glows, till its impurity melts inside it, and its scum is burned away.

12.verse: But the effort is in vain: its layers of scum will not leave it; so into the fire with its scum!

13.verse: Because of your filthy lewdness, because you refused to be purified when I wanted to purify you; now you will not be purified from your filth until I have satisfied my fury on you.

14.verse: “‘I, ADONAI, have spoken it, and it will happen. I will do it, I will not turn back, I will not refrain or spare or relent. They will judge you as your ways and deeds deserve,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

15.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

16.verse: “Human being, with a single blow I am about to deprive you of the delight of your eyes. But you are not to lament, weep or let your tears run down.

17.verse: Sigh silently, don’t observe mourning for the dead, bind your turban on your head, put your sandals on your feet, don’t cover your upper lip, and don’t eat the food people prepare for mourners.”

18.verse: I spoke to the people in the morning, and that evening my wife died. So I did the following morning as I had been ordered.

19.verse: The people asked me, “Won’t you tell us what these actions of yours mean for us?”

20.verse: I answered them, “The word of ADONAI came to me, telling me

21.verse: to speak to the house of Isra’el and say that this is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I am about to profane my sanctuary, the pride of your strength, the delight of your eyes and your heart’s desire. Your sons and daughters whom you have left behind will die by the sword.

22.verse: But you are to do as I have done — not cover your upper lips, not eat the food people prepare for mourners,

23.verse: put your turbans on your heads and your sandals on your feet, and neither observe mourning nor cry. Rather, because of your crimes you will pine away and groan to one another.

24.verse: Thus Yechezk’el will be a sign for you; you will do just what he has done; and when this happens, you will know that I am Adonai ELOHIM.’

25.verse: “As for you, human being, on the day when I take away from them their stronghold, their crowning joy, the delight of their eyes, their heart’s desire, their sons and daughters —

26.verse: on that day a fugitive will come and bring you the news;

27.verse: and on that day your mouth will be opened for you to speak to the survivor and no longer be silent. In this way you will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am ADONAI.”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, turn your face toward the people of ‘Amon and prophesy against them;

3.verse: say to the people of ‘Amon, ‘Hear the word of Adonai ELOHIM. Adonai ELOHIM says, “Because you gloated when my sanctuary was profaned, when the land of Isra’el was laid waste, and when the house of Y’hudah went into exile;

4.verse: I will let the people from the east take possession of you. They will set up camps and build their homes among you; they will eat your fruit and drink your milk.

5.verse: I will turn Rabbah into a camel pasture and ‘Amon into a sheep-yard. Then you will know that I am ADONAI.”

6.verse: For here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: “Because you clapped your hands and stamped your feet, full of malicious joy over the land of Isra’el;

7.verse: I am going to stretch out my hand over you and deliver you as plunder to the nations; I will cut you off from being a people and cause you to cease from being a nation; I will destroy you. Then you will know that I am ADONAI.’”

8.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Because Mo’av and Se‘ir say, “The house of Y’hudah is like all the other nations,”

9.verse: I will expose the flank of Mo’av, with all its cities — that is, all the cities on its frontier, the glory of the land, Beit-Yeshimot, Ba‘al-M‘on and Kiryatayim —

10.verse: together with the people of ‘Amon, to the people from the east, whom I will let take possession of them. Thus the people of ‘Amon will not be remembered as being one of the nations;

11.verse: and I will execute judgments on Mo’av. Then they will know that I am ADONAI.’

12.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Because Edom has taken severe vengeance against the house of Y’hudah, incurring much guilt by its acts of vengeance against them,

13.verse: therefore,’ Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘I will stretch my hand out over Edom and eliminate both its humans and its animals. I will make it a ruin; from Teman to D’dan they will die by the sword.

14.verse: Moreover, I will lay my vengeance on Edom through my people Isra’el; they will treat Edom in accordance with my anger and my fury; and they will know my vengeance’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

15.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘Because the P’lishtim have acted out of vengeance, taking revenge and destroying with malice of heart, due to their long-standing hatred;

16.verse: therefore,’ Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘I will stretch out my hand over the P’lishtim, eliminate the K’reti and destroy the rest of the seacoast peoples.

17.verse: I will execute great vengeance on them with furious punishments; and they will know that I am ADONAI when I lay my vengeance on them.’”

1.verse: On the first day of the month in the eleventh year, the word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, since Tzor has said against Yerushalayim, ‘Ha! She is shattered, the gateway of the peoples. Now that she is ruined, her riches will be mine’;

3.verse: therefore, Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘Look, Tzor! I am against you. Just as the sea churns up its waves, I will churn up many nations against you.

4.verse: They will destroy the walls of Tzor, they will demolish her towers. I will scrape its soil from her and reduce her to bare rock.

5.verse: With the sea all around her, she will be a place for drying fish nets and a plunder for the nations. I have spoken,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

6.verse: ‘Her daughters on the mainland will be put to death with the sword; then they will know that I am ADONAI.’

7.verse: “For here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I will bring upon Tzor, from the north, N’vukhadretzar king of Bavel, king of kings, with horses, chariots, cavalry, and a great and powerful army.

8.verse: “ ‘Your daughters on the mainland he will put to death with the sword. He will build siege-towers against you, he will build a ramp against you and raise a screen of shields against you.

9.verse: He will pound your walls with his battering-rams and break down your towers with his axes.

10.verse: His horses are so many that their dust will cover you. The thunder of cavalry, wagons and chariots will shake your walls, as he enters your gates, like men storming a city through a breach.

11.verse: With the hoofs of his horses he will trample your streets. He will put your people to the sword and pull to the ground your massive standing-stones.

12.verse: They will seize your wealth, loot your wares, break down your walls, destroy your fine houses; then they will throw your stones and timber and even your dust into the sea.

13.verse: I will put an end to your singing, the sound of your lyres will be heard no more.

14.verse: I will reduce you to bare rock, you will be a place for drying fish nets, you will never be built again, for I, ADONAI, have spoken,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

15.verse: To Tzor Adonai ELOHIM says: “How the coastlands will shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when the slaughter takes place in you!

16.verse: Then all the princes of the sea will step down from their thrones; they will put aside their robes and strip off their embroidered garments. They will clothe themselves with trembling; they will sit on the ground, trembling all the time, appalled at your condition.

17.verse: Then they will raise this lament for you: “‘How you have been destroyed, you who were peopled from the seas, city so renowned, once so strong at sea, you and your inhabitants, who used to spread terror over all [the mainland’s] inhabitants!

18.verse: Now the coastlands tremble on the day of your downfall, and the islands in the sea are in shock at your end.’

19.verse: “For here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘When I make you a ruined city, like other uninhabited cities; when I bring the deep sea over you, and its mighty waters cover you;

20.verse: then I will bring you down with those who descend to the pit, to the people of long ago, and make you live in underworld places like those who were ruined long ago, with those who descend to the pit, so that you will be uninhabited when I give glory to the land of the living.

21.verse: I will make you horrible; you will cease to exist. People will seek you but never more find you,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “You, human being, raise this lament for Tzor;

3.verse: say to Tzor, located at the gateways to the sea, merchant for peoples to many coastlands, that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Tzor, you have said, “My beauty is perfect.”

4.verse: Your borders are in the heart of the sea, your builders perfected your beauty.

5.verse: They used cypress logs from S’nir to fashion all your planking. They took cedars from the L’vanon to make masts for you.

6.verse: Out of oaks from Bashan they made your oars. Your deck they made of ivory inlaid in larch from the coasts of Kittim.

7.verse: Richly woven linen from Egypt was used for your sail, which was also your banner. Blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah was used to cover your deck-tent.

8.verse: The people of Tzidon and Arvad served as your oarsmen. Your own skilled men, Tzor, were there as your pilots.

9.verse: The leaders and craftsmen of G’val sealed the cracks between your boards. “‘Every seagoing ship and its crew came to you to trade in your wares.

10.verse: Men from Paras, Lud and Put were [mercenaries] in your army; hanging shield and helmet on you, they showed off your splendor.

11.verse: Men from Arvad and your own army were posted around on your walls. The Gamadim were in your towers; they hung their shields all around your walls, making your beauty perfect.

12.verse: “‘Tarshish did business with you because of the quantity and variety of your resources; they exchanged silver, iron, tin and lead for your goods.

13.verse: Greece, Tuval and Meshekh traded with you, exchanging slaves and articles of bronze for your wares.

14.verse: The people of Togarmah traded for your merchandise with horses, horsemen and mules.

15.verse: The men of D’dan traded with you. Many coastlands were your customers, giving you ivory tusks and ebony in payment.

16.verse: Aram traded with you, because you were so wealthy; for your goods they exchanged green feldspar, purple stuff, embroidery, fine linen, coral and rubies.

17.verse: Y’hudah and the land of Isra’el also traded with you, exchanging for your goods wheat from Minnit, millet, honey, olive oil and resin for healing.

18.verse: Because you were so wealthy, with such a variety of valuable merchandise, Dammesek traded wine from Helbon and white wool with you.

19.verse: V’dan and Yavan from Uzal traded ironwork, cassia and aromatic cane for your goods.

20.verse: D’dan traded with you for riding gear.

21.verse: Arabia and all the princes of K’dar were your customers; for your goods they traded lambs, rams and goats.

22.verse: The traders of Sh’va and Ra‘mah exchanged the best quality spices, all kinds of precious stones and gold for your goods.

23.verse: The merchants of Haran, Kaneh and ‘Eden, who traded also with Sh’va, Ashur and Kilmad,

24.verse: brought you in exchange for your goods rich clothes, cloaks made of blue material and embroidery, and cedar-lined chests filled with multicolored clothing and bound with cords.

25.verse: “Tarshish” ships transported your imports and exports. “‘So you were full, loaded down, surrounded by the sea.

26.verse: Your oarsmen brought you through heavy seas. But the east wind will break you surrounded by the sea.

27.verse: Your riches, your goods, your merchandise, your crew, your pilots, your ship-sealers, your traders, all your warriors aboard, and all the others in the ship with you will sink surrounded by the sea on the day of your shipwreck.

28.verse: When they hear the cries of your pilots, the mainland coasts will tremble.

29.verse: The oarsmen, crew and pilots will disembark and stand on shore,

30.verse: mourning aloud at your fate, crying bitterly, throwing dust on their heads, rolling in the ashes,

31.verse: shaving their heads bald for you, wrapping themselves in sackcloth, with heartfelt bitterness weeping for you in bitter lamentation.

32.verse: Wailing, they will raise a lament for you; this will be their lament for you: “‘“Who anywhere in the sea has ever been silenced like Tzor?

33.verse: When your wares came forth from the seas, you satisfied many peoples; with your vast wealth and variety of goods you enriched the kings of the earth.

34.verse: But now you have been wrecked by the waves, sunk in the watery depths; your merchandise and all your people have gone down with you.

35.verse: All who live along the coasts are aghast at you; their kings are horribly afraid, their faces are convulsed;

36.verse: the merchants among the peoples are gasping at your fate; you are an object of terror, and you will cease to exist.”’”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, tell the prince of Tzor that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Because you are so proud and have said, “I am a god; I sit on the throne of God, surrounded by the sea”; yet you are a man, not God, even though you think that you think like God.

3.verse: Sure, you are wiser than Dani’el! No secret can be hidden from you!

4.verse: By your wisdom and discernment you have acquired wealth, you have gathered gold and silver into your treasuries.

5.verse: By your great skill in trading you have increased your wealth, and it is because of your wealth that you have become so proud.

6.verse: “Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘Because you think that you think like God,

7.verse: I will bring foreigners against you, the most barbarous of the nations, to draw their swords against your fine wisdom and defile your splendor.

8.verse: They will lower you into the pit to die a violent death surrounded by the sea.

9.verse: Will you still say, “I am God,” to them who are about to kill you? You are a man, you are not God, in the hands of those who defile you.

10.verse: You will die the deaths of the uncircumcised at the hands of foreigners. For I have spoken,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

11.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

12.verse: “Human being, raise a lament for the king of Tzor, and tell him that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘You put the seal on perfection; you were full of wisdom and perfect in beauty;

13.verse: you were in ‘Eden, the garden of God; covered with all kinds of precious stones — carnelians, topaz, diamonds, beryl, onyx, jasper, sapphires, green feldspar, emeralds; your pendants and jewels were made of gold, prepared the day you were created.

14.verse: You were a keruv, protecting a large region; I placed you on God’s holy mountain. You walked back and forth among stones of fire.

15.verse: You were perfect in your ways from the day you were created, until unrighteousness was found in you.

16.verse: “‘When your commerce grew, you became filled with violence; and in this way you sinned. Therefore I have thrown you out, defiled, from the mountain of God; I have destroyed you, protecting keruv, from among the stones of fire.

17.verse: Your heart grew proud because of your beauty, you corrupted your wisdom for the sake of your splendor. But I have thrown you on the ground; before kings I have made you a spectacle.

18.verse: By your many crimes in dishonest trading, you have profaned your sanctuaries; therefore I brought forth fire from within you, and it has devoured you; I reduced you into ashes on the ground in the sight of all who can see you.

19.verse: All who know you among the peoples will be aghast at you. You are an object of terror, and you will cease to exist.’”

20.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

21.verse: “Human being, turn your face toward Tzidon, and prophesy against it.

22.verse: Say that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I am against you, Tzidon; but I will be glorified in you. They will know that I am ADONAI, once I execute judgments in her and show my holiness in her.

23.verse: For I will send plagues into her, and blood will flow in her streets; attacked from all sides by the sword, the wounded will fall within her. Then they will know that I am ADONAI.

24.verse: “‘The house of Isra’el will no longer have a briar pricking away at them, no longer will any of its contemptuous neighbors be a thorn to stab them. Then they will know that I am Adonai ELOHIM.’

25.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘Once I have gathered the house of Isra’el from the peoples among whom they are scattered, once I have shown my holiness in them as the Goyim watch, then they will live in their own land, which I gave to my servant Ya‘akov.

26.verse: They will have security when they live there, building houses and planting vineyards; yes, they will live in safety, once I have executed judgments against all their contemptuous neighbors. Then they will know that I am ADONAI their God.’”

1.verse: On the twelfth day of the tenth month of the tenth year, the word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, turn your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt; prophesy against him and against all Egypt;

3.verse: speak out; and say that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, you big crocodile lying in the streams of the Nile! You say, “My Nile is mine; I made it for myself.”

4.verse: But I will put hooks in your jaws and make your Nile fish stick to your scales. Yes, I will bring you up from your Nile, with all your Nile fish sticking to your scales,

5.verse: and leave you in the desert, you and all your Nile fish. You will fall in the open field and not be gathered or buried; but I will give you as food to wild animals and birds.

6.verse: Then all who live in Egypt will know that I am ADONAI, because they have been a support made of straw for the house of Isra’el.

7.verse: When they grasped you in hand, you splintered and threw all their shoulders out of joint; when they leaned on you, you broke and made them all wrench their backs.’

8.verse: “Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘I will bring the sword against you and eliminate both your people and your animals.

9.verse: The land of Egypt will become a desolate waste, and they will know that I am ADONAI; because he said, “The Nile is mine; I made it.”

10.verse: So I am against you and your Nile; and I will make the land of Egypt a totally desolate waste from Migdol to S’venah, all the way to the border of Ethiopia.

11.verse: No human foot will pass through it, and no animal foot will pass through it; it will be uninhabited for forty years.

12.verse: Yes, I will make the land of Egypt desolate, even when compared with other desolate countries, likewise her cities in comparison with other ruined cities; they will be desolate forty years. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them through the countries.’

13.verse: “For this is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples where they were scattered —

14.verse: I will restore the fortunes of Egypt and cause them to return to the land of their origin, Patros. But there they will be a humble kingdom,

15.verse: the humblest of kingdoms. It will never again dominate other nations; I will reduce them, so that they never again rule other nations.

16.verse: Moreover, they will no longer be a source of confidence for Isra’el to turn to; rather, it will only bring to mind their guilt in having turned to them before. Then they will know that I am Adonai ELOHIM.’”

17.verse: On the first day of the first month of the twenty-seventh year, the word of ADONAI came to me:

18.verse: “Human being, N’vukhadretzar king of Bavel had his army mount a massive expedition against Tzor; [the loads of dirt they carried] made every head bald and every shoulder raw; yet neither he nor his army derived any benefit from Tzor out of this expedition against it.

19.verse: Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘I will give the land of Egypt to N’vukhadretzar king of Bavel. He will carry off its riches, take its spoil and its prey; and these will be the wages for his army.

20.verse: I am giving him the land of Egypt as his wages for which he worked, because they were working for me,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

21.verse: ‘When that day comes I will cause power to return to the house of Isra’el, and I will enable you [Yechezk’el] to open your mouth among them. Then they will know that I am ADONAI.’”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, prophesy; say that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘Wail, “Oh no! It’s today!”

3.verse: For the day is near, the Day of ADONAI, a day of clouds, the time of the Goyim.

4.verse: The sword will come against Egypt, and Ethiopia will be in anguish, when the slain fall in Egypt, when they take away her wealth, and her foundations are torn down.

5.verse: Ethiopia, Put and Lud, all the mixed population and Kuv, and the people of allied lands will die by the sword with them.’

6.verse: “ADONAI says this: ‘Those supporting Egypt will fall; its arrogant power will be brought down; from Migdol to S’venah they will die by the sword,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

7.verse: “They will be desolate even when compared with other desolate countries, likewise her cities in comparison with other ruined cities.

8.verse: They will know that I am ADONAI when I set fire to Egypt, and those supporting it are destroyed.

9.verse: When that day comes, I will send out messengers in ships to terrify the unsuspecting Ethiopians; and anguish will overcome them on the day of Egypt. Yes, here it comes!

10.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I will destroy the hordes of Egypt through N’vukhadretzar king of Bavel.

11.verse: He and his people, the most barbarous of the nations, will be brought in to ravage the land. They will unsheathe their swords against Egypt and fill the land with corpses.

12.verse: I will dry up the streams of the Nile and sell the land to the wicked. Through the power of foreigners I will make the land and all that is in it desolate. I, ADONAI, have spoken.’

13.verse: “Here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I will destroy the idols, make the false gods in Nof cease to exist. No longer will there be a prince from the land of Egypt; I will put fear in the land of Egypt,

14.verse: desolate Patros, set fire to Tzo‘an, execute judgements in No,

15.verse: pour my fury on Seen the stronghold of Egypt, and destroy the hordes of No.

16.verse: Yes, I will set fire to Egypt; Seen will writhe in anguish; No will be torn apart; enemies will attack Nof in broad daylight.

17.verse: The young men of On and Pi-Veset will die by the sword, while the cities themselves will go into captivity.

18.verse: At T’chafn’ches the day will grow dark when I break the yokes of Egypt there, and the pride she takes in her power ceases. A cloud will cover her, and her daughters will go into captivity.

19.verse: Thus will I execute judgments on Egypt. Then they will know that I am ADONAI.’”

20.verse: On the seventh day of the first month of the eleventh year, the word of ADONAI came to me:

21.verse: “Human being, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; it has not been bound up with dressings and bandages, so that it can heal and become strong enough again to wield the sword.

22.verse: Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break his arms, both the sound one and the broken one, and I will make the sword fall from his hand.

23.verse: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.

24.verse: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Bavel and put my sword in his hand; but I will break the arms of Pharaoh; he will groan like a man mortally wounded.

25.verse: Yes, I will hold up the arms of the king of Bavel; but the arms of Pharaoh will droop. They will know that I am ADONAI when I put my sword in the hand of the king of Bavel, and he stretches it out over the land of Egypt.

26.verse: Yes, I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries; and they will know that I am ADONAI.’”

1.verse: On the first day of the third month of the eleventh year, the word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his hordes: ‘Whom are you like in your greatness?

3.verse: Like Ashur, a cedar in the L’vanon. It had beautiful branches, dense foliage, its tall crown surrounded by leafy boughs.

4.verse: The water nourished it; the deep made it grow, sending its rivers round the place where it was planted, sending its streams to all the trees in the fields.

5.verse: So it grew taller than any other tree, its branches grew in number and spread far and wide, for it had plenty of water to make them grow.

6.verse: In its boughs all the birds of the air had their nests, beneath its branches all the wild animals gave birth to their young, and all great nations lived in its shade.

7.verse: It was beautiful in its greatness and the length of its branches, because its roots went down to plenty of water.

8.verse: No cedar in God’s garden was like it, no cypress tree could compare with its boughs, no chestnut tree could rival its branches, no tree in God’s garden could match its beauty.

9.verse: I made it so beautiful, with its many branches; all trees in ‘Eden, God’s garden, envied it.’

10.verse: “Therefore here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘Because you are so tall, because he has lifted his crown above the leafy boughs, because he has grown so arrogant about his height,

11.verse: I am handing him over to the mightiest of the nations, who will certainly deal with him as his wickedness deserves; I reject him.

12.verse: Foreigners, the most barbarous of the nations, will destroy him and leave him lying where he is. His branches will lie fallen on the mountains and in the valleys, his boughs will lie broken in all the rivers of the land, and all the peoples of the earth will withdraw from his shade and leave him.

13.verse: All the birds will settle on his fallen trunk, and all the wild animals will be on his branches.

14.verse: This is to warn all the trees growing near water not to grow so tall, not to lift their crowns above the leafy boughs, and all that take up water not to reach up in their height. For they are all given over to death, to the depths of the underworld, along with human beings, with those who descend to the pit.’

15.verse: “Here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘On the day he descended to Sh’ol, I caused the abyss to mourn and cover itself for him; I held back its rivers, so that its deep waters were stopped. I made the L’vanon mourn for him, and all the field trees withered because of him.

16.verse: At the sound of his fall I made the nations shake, when I hurled him down to Sh’ol with those who descend to the pit. All the trees of ‘Eden, the pick of the best in the L’vanon, all that take up water, were consoled in the underworld.

17.verse: They descended with him to Sh’ol to those who were killed by the sword, to those who were his fighting arm, those among the nations who lived in his shade.

18.verse: Which of the trees of ‘Eden was your equal in glory or size? Yet you will be brought down to the underworld along with the trees of ‘Eden. You will lie there among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword. This is Pharaoh and his hordes,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

1.verse: On the first day of the twelfth month of the twelfth year, the word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, raise a lament for Pharaoh king of Egypt; say to him, ‘You compared yourself to a lion among the nations; In fact, you are more like a crocodile in the lakes. You burst out of your streams, churn the water with your feet and foul their streams.’

3.verse: “So here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘With many nations assembled, I will spread my net over you, and they will haul you up in my dragnet.

4.verse: Then I will throw you on the shore, hurl you into an open field, make all the birds in the air settle on you and let the animals of the whole earth eat their fill of you.

5.verse: I will leave your flesh on the mountains and fill the valleys with your rotting carcass.

6.verse: I will drench the land in which you swim with your blood, as far as the mountains; the waterways will be full of you.

7.verse: When I extinguish you, I will cover the sky and make its stars black; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon will not give its light.

8.verse: All the shining lights in the sky I will darken above you; I will spread darkness over your land,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

9.verse: “‘I will anger many peoples when I bring your destroyed ones in among the nations, into countries you have not known.

10.verse: I will make many peoples aghast at you; their kings will shudder in horror over you when I brandish my sword before them. On the day of your downfall they will tremble continuously, each man in fear of his life.’

11.verse: “For Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘The sword of the king of Bavel will come against you.

12.verse: With the swords of the warriors I will cause your hordes to fall. They are all the most barbarous of the nations, and they will shatter the glory of Egypt — all its hordes will be destroyed.

13.verse: I will destroy all her cattle beside her plentiful waters. No human foot will trouble them again, nor the hoof of any animal.

14.verse: Then I will make their water clear and cause their streams to flow like oil,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

15.verse: ‘When I make the land of Egypt a ruined waste, a land stripped of all that filled it; when I strike all those who live there; they will know that I am ADONAI.

16.verse: This is the lament that they will raise; the daughters of the nations will use it to mourn; they will chant it for Egypt and all its hordes,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

17.verse: On the fifteenth day of the month in the twelfth year, the word of ADONAI came to me:

18.verse: “Human being, wail for the hordes of Egypt; send them with the daughters of mighty nations down to the underworld, with those who descend to the pit.

19.verse: Are you more beautiful than the others? Go down, lie with the uncircumcised dead!

20.verse: They will fall among those killed by the sword; she is given to the sword; pull her down with her hordes.

21.verse: From the depths of Sh’ol the mightiest warriors will speak of him with those who helped him. They went down; they lie still, the uncircumcised, killed by the sword.

22.verse: “Ashur is there with her hordes; their graves are all around them, all of them slain, killed by the sword.

23.verse: Their graves are in the deepest parts of the pit, her hordes are all around her grave, all of them slain, killed by the sword, those who terrorized the land of the living.

24.verse: “‘Eilam is there, with her hordes around her grave, all of them slain, killed by the sword, descended uncircumcised to the underworld, those who terrorized the land of the living; they bear their shame together with those who descended to the pit.

25.verse: They have given her a bed among the slain with her hordes; her graves are all around them, all of them uncircumcised, killed by the sword, because they terrorized the land of the living; they bear their shame with those who descended to the pit; they are put among those who were slain.

26.verse: “Meshekh and Tuval with her horde is there, her graves are all around them, all of them uncircumcised, killed by the sword, because they terrorized the land of the living.

27.verse: They do not lie with the fallen warriors of the uncircumcised who descended to Sh’ol with their weapons of war, their swords laid under their heads, and their crimes upon their bones; because these warriors terrorized the land of the living.

28.verse: But you will lie broken among the uncircumcised, with those who were killed by the sword.

29.verse: “There is Edom, her kings and all her princes, who, despite all their power, are laid with those who were killed by the sword, with the uncircumcised, with those who descended to the pit.

30.verse: “There are all the princes of the north, all of them, and the Tzidoni, who descended with the slain, ashamed of all the terror they caused by their power; they lie uncircumcised with those killed by the sword, bearing their shame with those who descended to the pit.

31.verse: “All of these Pharaoh will see, and he will be consoled about his hordes, Pharaoh and all his army, slain by the sword,” says Adonai ELOHIM.

32.verse: “For I have put my terror in the land of the living, and he will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword, Pharaoh and all his hordes,” says Adonai ELOHIM.

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, speak to your people; say to them, ‘Suppose I bring the sword on a country, and the people of that country take one of their men and appoint him their watchman.

3.verse: Now if, upon seeing the sword coming against that country, he blows the shofar and warns the people;

4.verse: then, if the sword comes and takes away someone who heard the sound of the shofar but paid no attention to it, the responsibility for that person’s death will be his own —

5.verse: he heard the shofar but paid no attention, so the responsibility for his death is his own; whereas if he had paid attention, he would have saved his life.

6.verse: But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the shofar, so that the people are not warned; and then the sword comes and takes any one of them, that one is indeed taken away in his guilt, but I will hold the watchman responsible for his death.’

7.verse: “Likewise you, human being — I have appointed you as watchman for the house of Isra’el. Therefore, when you hear the word from my mouth, warn them for me.

8.verse: When I tell the wicked person, ‘Wicked person, you will certainly die’; and you fail to speak and warn the wicked person to leave his way; then that wicked person will die guilty; and I will hold you responsible for his death.

9.verse: On the other hand, if you warn the wicked to turn from his way, and he doesn’t turn from his way; then he will still die guilty, but you will have saved your own life.

10.verse: “Therefore, you, human being, say to the house of Isra’el: ‘You say, “Our crimes and sins are weighing us down, we’re pining away because of them, how can we even stay alive?”’

11.verse: Say to them, ‘As I live,’ swears Adonai ELOHIM, ‘I take no pleasure in having the wicked person die, but in having the wicked person turn from his way and live. So repent! Turn from your evil ways! For why should you die, house of Isra’el?’

12.verse: “Next, you, human being, say to your people: ‘The righteousness of the righteous person will not save him, once he starts committing crimes; and likewise, the wickedness of the wicked person will not cause him to fall, once he turns from his wickedness. No, the righteous person cannot live by virtue of [his former righteousness], once he starts sinning.

13.verse: So if, after I tell the righteous person that he will surely live, he begins trusting in his own [former] righteousness and starts committing crimes; then none of his [former] righteous actions will be remembered; on the contrary, he will die for the evil deeds he has committed.

14.verse: Likewise, if, after I tell the wicked person, “You must die,” he turns from his sin and does what is lawful and right —

15.verse: if the wicked person restores pledged property and returns what he stole, so that he lives by the laws that give life and does not commit evil deeds; then he will live, he will not die.

16.verse: None of the sins he committed will be remembered against him; he has done what is lawful and right; he will surely live.’

17.verse: “Now your people say, ‘Adonai’s way isn’t fair!’ But it is their way, theirs, that isn’t fair!

18.verse: When the righteous person turns away from his righteousness and commits wickedness, he will die because of it.

19.verse: And when the wicked person turns from his wickedness and does what is lawful and right, he will live because of it.

20.verse: Yet you say, ‘Adonai’s way isn’t fair!’ House of Isra’el, I will judge each of you according to his ways.”

21.verse: In the twelfth year of our exile, on the fifth day of the tenth month, a fugitive from Yerushalayim came to me with the news, “The city has been struck.”

22.verse: Now the hand of ADONAI had been on me that evening, before the fugitive arrived — he had opened my mouth prior to his coming to me in the morning, so my mouth was open, and I was no longer mute.

23.verse: Then the word of ADONAI came to me:

24.verse: “Human being, those living in the desolate parts of the land of Isra’el are saying, ‘Avraham was only one, and he inherited the land. But we are many, so [how much more] is the land given to us to inherit!’

25.verse: Therefore, tell them that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘You eat [flesh] with the blood, you raise your eyes to your idols, and you shed blood — and you still expect to possess the land?

26.verse: You depend on your swords, you commit disgusting practices, and each of you defiles his neighbor’s wife — and you still expect to possess the land?’

27.verse: Tell them that Adonai ELOHIM swears, ‘As I live, those living in the ruins will fall by the sword, those in the countryside I will give to the wild animals to eat, and those in the fortresses and caves will die of the plague.

28.verse: Moreover, I will utterly desolate the land; it will cease taking pride in its power; and the mountains of Isra’el will be so desolate that no one will pass through.’

29.verse: Then they will know that I am ADONAI, when I have made the land utterly desolate, because of all the disgusting practices they have committed.

30.verse: “Now you, human being, your people are gathering and talking about you by the walls and in the doorways of houses. They’re saying to each other, each one telling his brother, ‘Come, let’s go and hear the latest word coming from ADONAI.’

31.verse: So then they come to you, as people do, sit in front of you as my people, and hear your words; but they don’t act on them. For with their mouths they flatter you, but their hearts are set on their own self-interest;

32.verse: so for them you are like a love-song sung by someone with a nice voice who can play an instrument well — they hear your words, but they don’t act on them.

33.verse: So when all this comes true, then, at last, they will realize that a prophet has been there with them.”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, prophesy against the shepherds of Isra’el. Prophesy! Tell them, the shepherds, that Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘Woe to the shepherds of Isra’el who feed themselves! Shouldn’t the shepherds feed the sheep?

3.verse: You eat the choice meat, you clothe yourselves with the wool, and you slaughter the best of the herd; but you don’t feed the sheep!

4.verse: You don’t strengthen the weak, heal the sick, bandage the broken, bring back the outcasts or seek the lost; on the contrary, you tyrannize them with crushing force.

5.verse: So they were scattered, without a shepherd, and became food for every wild animal — they were scattered.

6.verse: My sheep wandered around aimlessly on every mountain and hill; yes, my sheep were scattered all over the land, with no one to search for them or look after them.

7.verse: “‘Therefore, shepherds, hear the word of ADONAI:

8.verse: “As I live,” Adonai ELOHIM swears, “because my sheep have become prey, my sheep have become food for every wild animal, since there was no shepherd, since my shepherds didn’t look for my sheep, and instead my shepherds fed themselves but not my sheep,”

9.verse: therefore, shepherds, hear the word of ADONAI!

10.verse: Adonai ELOHIM says, “I am against the shepherds. I demand that they hand my sheep back to me. I will not allow them to feed the sheep, and they won’t feed themselves either. I will rescue my sheep from their mouths; they will be food for them no longer.”

11.verse: “‘For here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: “I am taking over! I will search for my sheep and look after them, myself.

12.verse: Just as a shepherd looks after his flock when he finds himself among his scattered sheep, so I will look after my sheep. I will rescue them from all the places where they were scattered when it was cloudy and dark.

13.verse: I will bring them back from those peoples, gather them from those countries and return them to their own land. Then I will let them feed on the mountains of Isra’el, by the streams and in all the livable places of the land.

14.verse: I will have them feed in good pastures; their grazing ground will be on the high mountains of Isra’el. They will rest in good grazing grounds and feed in rich pastures on Isra’el’s mountains.

15.verse: Yes, I will pasture my sheep; and I will let them rest” says Adonai ELOHIM.

16.verse: “I will seek the lost, bring back the outcasts, bandage the broken, and strengthen the sick. But the fat and the strong I will destroy — I will feed them with judgment.”

17.verse: “‘As for you, my flock,’ Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘I will judge between sheep and other sheep, between rams and billy-goats.

18.verse: Wasn’t it enough for you to feed on the best pasture and drink from the clearest water? Did you have to trample the rest of the pasture and foul the remaining water with your feet?

19.verse: So now my sheep eat what you have trampled with your feet and drink water fouled by your feet.’

20.verse: Therefore here is what Adonai ELOHIM says to them: ‘I will judge between the fat sheep and the thin sheep.

21.verse: Because you push them with your flanks and shoulders and butt all the weak ones with your horns, till you scatter them in every direction;

22.verse: therefore I will save my flock; they will no longer be prey; and I will judge between sheep and other sheep.

23.verse: “‘I will raise up one shepherd to be in charge of them, and he will let them feed — my servant David. He will pasture them and be their shepherd.

24.verse: I, ADONAI, will be their God; and my servant David will be prince among them. I, ADONAI, have spoken.

25.verse: I will make a covenant of peace with them; I will rid the land of wild animals; and they will live securely in the desert and sleep in the forests.

26.verse: I will make them and the places around my hill a blessing, and I will cause the rain to fall when it should — there will be showers of blessing.

27.verse: The trees in the field will bear their fruit and the soil its produce, and they will be secure in their land. Then they will know that I am ADONAI, when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from the power of those who turned them into slaves.

28.verse: No longer will they be prey for the Goyim, nor will the wild animals devour them; but they will live securely, with no one to make them afraid.

29.verse: I will make the productivity of their crops famous, and they will no longer be consumed by hunger in the land or bear the shame of the Goyim any more.

30.verse: They will know that I, ADONAI their God, am with them, and that they, the house of Isra’el, are my people,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

31.verse: ‘You, my sheep, the sheep in my pasture, are human beings; and I am your God,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, turn your face against Mount Se‘ir; prophesy against it,

3.verse: and say that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘I am against you, Mount Se‘ir. I will stretch out my hand against you and make you utterly desolate.

4.verse: I will make your cities ruins and make you an utter waste, and you will know that I am ADONAI.

5.verse: Because of your long-standing hatred, you put the people of Isra’el to the sword at their time of calamity, at the time of final iniquity.

6.verse: Therefore, as I live,’ Adonai ELOHIM swears, ‘I will prepare you for blood. Blood will pursue you. You intensely hate your own blood [relatives]; therefore blood will pursue you.

7.verse: Yes, I will make Mount Se‘ir utterly desolate, cutting off from it anyone passing through or returning.

8.verse: I will fill his mountains with his slain; in your hills and valleys and in all your ravines will fall those slain by the sword.

9.verse: I will turn you into perpetual ruins; your cities will not return; and you will know that I am ADONAI.

10.verse: “‘Because you say, “These two nations, these two countries, will be mine; we will take possession of them,” even though ADONAI is there;

11.verse: therefore, as I live,’ swears Adonai ELOHIM, ‘I will deal with you as your anger and envy arising from your hatred deserve; and I will make myself known among them when I judge you.

12.verse: You will know that I, ADONAI, have heard all your blasphemous talk against the mountains of Isra’el, such as, “They are desolated, they are given to us to devour.”

13.verse: Moreover, you have boasted against me with your mouths, speaking more and more against me — I have heard it.’

14.verse: Here is what Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘To the joy of all the land, I will desolate you.

15.verse: Since you rejoiced over possessing the house of Isra’el, because it was desolate, that is what I will do to you — you will be desolate, Mount Se‘ir and all Edom, all of it. Then they will know that I am ADONAI.’

1.verse: “Now you, human being, prophesy to the mountains of Isra’el. Say: ‘Mountains of Isra’el, hear the message from ADONAI.

2.verse: Adonai ELOHIM says: “The enemy is boasting over you, ‘Ha! Even the ancient high places are ours now!’ ” ’

3.verse: Therefore prophesy, and say that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘Because they desolated you and swallowed you up from every side, so that the other nations could take possession of you; and now people are gossiping about you and slandering you;

4.verse: therefore, mountains of Isra’el, hear the message of Adonai ELOHIM — this is what Adonai ELOHIM says to the mountains and hills, the streams and valleys, the desolate wastes and the abandoned cities, now preyed on and derided by the other surrounding nations —

5.verse: therefore this is what Adonai ELOHIM says: “In the heat of my jealousy I speak against the other nations and all of Edom, since, rejoicing with all their heart, they have arrogated my land to themselves as a possession and, with utter contempt, seized it as prey.”’

6.verse: “Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Isra’el, and say to the mountains, the hills, the streams and the valleys that Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘I speak in my jealousy and fury, because you have endured being shamed by the nations.

7.verse: Therefore thus says Adonai ELOHIM: “I have raised my hand and sworn that the nations surrounding you will bear their shame.

8.verse: But you, mountains of Isra’el, you will sprout your branches and bear your fruit for my people Isra’el, who will soon return.

9.verse: I am here for you, and I will turn toward you; then you will be tilled and sown;

10.verse: and I will multiply your population, all the house of Isra’el, all of it. The cities will be inhabited and the ruins rebuilt.

11.verse: I will multiply both the human and animal populations, they will increase and be productive; and I will cause you to be inhabited as you were before — indeed, I will do you more good than before; and you will know that I am ADONAI.

12.verse: I will cause people to walk on you, my people Isra’el; they will possess you, and you will be their inheritance; never again will you make them childless.”

13.verse: Adonai ELOHIM says, “Because they say to you, ‘Land, you devour people and make your nations childless,’

14.verse: therefore you will no longer devour people, and you will not make your nations childless any more,” says Adonai ELOHIM.

15.verse: “I will not permit the nations to shame you, or the peoples to reproach you any longer; and you will no more cause your nations to stumble,” says Adonai ELOHIM.’”

16.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

17.verse: “Human being, when the house of Isra’el lived in their own land, they defiled it by their manner of life and their actions; their way before me was like the uncleanness of niddah.

18.verse: Therefore I poured out my fury on them, because of the blood they had shed in the land and because they defiled it with their idols.

19.verse: I scattered them among the nations and dispersed them throughout the countries; I judged them in keeping with their manner of life and actions.

20.verse: When they came to the nations they were going to, they profaned my holy name; so that people said of them, ‘These are ADONAI’s people, who have been exiled from his land.’

21.verse: But I am concerned about my holy name, which the house of Isra’el is profaning among the nations where they have gone.

22.verse: “Therefore tell the house of Isra’el that Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘I am not going to do this for your sake, house of Isra’el, but for the sake of my holy name, which you have been profaning among the nations where you went.

23.verse: I will set apart my great name to be regarded as holy, since it has been profaned in the nations — you profaned it among them. The nations will know that I am ADONAI,’ says Adonai ELOHIM, ‘when, before their eyes, I am set apart through you to be regarded as holy.

24.verse: For I will take you from among the nations, gather you from all the countries, and return you to your own soil.

25.verse: Then I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean; I will cleanse you from all your uncleanness and from all your idols.

26.verse: I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit inside you; I will take the stony heart out of your flesh and give you a heart of flesh.

27.verse: I will put my Spirit inside you and cause you to live by my laws, respect my rulings and obey them.

28.verse: You will live in the land I gave to your ancestors. You will be my people, and I will be your God.

29.verse: I will save you from all your uncleanliness. I will summon the grain and increase it, and not send famine against you.

30.verse: I will multiply the yield of fruit from the trees and increase production in the fields, so that you never again suffer the reproach of famine among the nations.

31.verse: Then you will remember your evil ways and your actions that were not good; as you look at yourselves, you will loathe yourselves for your guilt and disgusting practices.

32.verse: Understand,’ says Adonai ELOHIM, ‘that I am not doing this for your sake. Instead, be ashamed and dismayed for your ways, house of Isra’el.’

33.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘When the day comes for me to cleanse you from all your guilt, I will cause the cities to be inhabited and the ruins to be rebuilt.

34.verse: The land that was desolate will be tilled, whereas formerly it lay desolate for all passing by to see.

35.verse: Then they will say, “The land that used to be desolate has become like Gan-‘Eden, and the cities formerly ruined, abandoned and wasted have been fortified and are inhabited!”

36.verse: Then the nations around you that remain will know that I, ADONAI, have rebuilt the ruins and replanted what was abandoned. I, ADONAI, have spoken; and I will do it.’

37.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘In addition, I will let the house of Isra’el pray to me to do this for them: to increase their numbers like sheep —

38.verse: like flocks of sheep for sacrifices, like the flocks of sheep in Yerushalayim at its designated times, in this degree will the ruined cities be filled with flocks of people. Then they will know that I am ADONAI.’”

1.verse: With the hand of ADONAI upon me, ADONAI carried me out by his Spirit and set me down in the middle of the valley, and it was full of bones.

2.verse: He had me pass by all around them — there were so many bones lying in the valley, and they were so dry!

3.verse: He asked me, “Human being, can these bones live?” I answered, “Adonai ELOHIM! Only you know that!”

4.verse: Then he said to me, “Prophesy over these bones! Say to them, ‘Dry bones! Hear what ADONAI has to say!

5.verse: To these bones Adonai ELOHIM says, “I will make breath enter you, and you will live.

6.verse: I will attach ligaments to you, make flesh grow on you, cover you with skin and put breath in you. You will live, and you will know that I am ADONAI.”’”

7.verse: So I prophesied as ordered; and while I was prophesying, there was a noise, a rattling sound; it was the bones coming together, each bone in its proper place.

8.verse: As I watched, ligaments grew on them, flesh appeared and skin covered them; but there was no breath in them.

9.verse: Next he said to me, “Prophesy to the breath! Prophesy, human being! Say to the breath that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘Come from the four winds, breath; and breathe on these slain, so that they can live.’”

10.verse: So I prophesied as ordered, and the breath came into them, and they were alive! They stood up on their feet, a huge army!

11.verse: Then he said to me, “Human being! These bones are the whole house of Isra’el; and they are saying, ‘Our bones have dried up, our hope is gone, and we are completely cut off.’

12.verse: Therefore prophesy; say to them that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘My people! I will open your graves and make you get up out of your graves, and I will bring you into the land of Isra’el.

13.verse: Then you will know that I am ADONAI — when I have opened your graves and made you get up out of your graves, my people!

14.verse: I will put my Spirit in you; and you will be alive. Then I will place you in your own land; and you will know that I, ADONAI, have spoken, and that I have done it,’ says ADONAI.”

15.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

16.verse: “You, human being, take one stick and write on it, ‘For Y’hudah and those joined with him [among] the people of Isra’el.’ Next, take another stick and write on it, ‘For Yosef, the stick of Efrayim, and all the house of Isra’el who are joined with him.’

17.verse: Finally, bring them together into a single stick, so that they become one in your hand.

18.verse: When your people ask you what all this means,

19.verse: tell them that Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘I will take the stick of Yosef, which is in the hand of Efrayim, together with the tribes of Isra’el who are joined with him, and put them together with the stick of Y’hudah and make them a single stick, so that they become one in my hand.’

20.verse: The sticks on which you write are to be in your hand as they watch.

21.verse: Then say to them that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I will take the people of Isra’el from among the nations where they have gone and gather them from every side and bring them back to their own land.

22.verse: I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Isra’el; and one king will be king for all of them. They will no longer be two nations, and they will never again be divided into two kingdoms.

23.verse: “‘They will never again defile themselves with their idols, their detestable things, or any of their transgressions; but I will save them from all the places where they have been living and sinning; and I will cleanse them, so that they will be my people, and I will be their God.

24.verse: My servant David will be king over them, and all of them will have one shepherd; they will live by my rulings and keep and observe my regulations.

25.verse: They will live in the land I gave to Ya‘akov my servant, where your ancestors lived; they will live there — they, their children, and their grandchildren, forever; and David my servant will be their leader forever.

26.verse: I will make a covenant of peace with them, an everlasting covenant. I will give to them, increase their numbers, and set my sanctuary among them forever.

27.verse: My home will be with them; I will be their God, and they will be my people.

28.verse: The nations will know that I am ADONAI, who sets Isra’el apart as holy, when my sanctuary is with them forever.’”

1.verse: The word of ADONAI came to me:

2.verse: “Human being, turn your face toward Gog (of the land of Magog), chief prince of Meshekh and Tuval; and prophesy against him.

3.verse: Say that Adonai ELOHIM says, ‘I am against you, Gog, chief prince of Meshekh and Tuval.

4.verse: I will turn you around, put hooks in your jaws and bring you out with all your army, horses and horsemen, all completely equipped, a great horde with breastplates and shields, all wielding swords.

5.verse: Paras, Ethiopia and Put are with them, all with breastplates and helmets;

6.verse: Gomer with all its troops; the house of Togarmah in the far reaches of the north, with all its troops — many peoples are with you.

7.verse: Prepare yourself, get ready, you and all your crowd gathered around you; and take charge of them.

8.verse: After many days have passed, you will be mustered for service; in later years you will invade the land which has been brought back from the sword, gathered out of many peoples, the mountains of Isra’el. They had been lying in ruins for a long time, but now Isra’el has been extracted from the peoples and all of them are living there securely.

9.verse: You will come up like a storm, you will be like a cloud covering the land — you and all your troops, and many other peoples with you.’

10.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘When that day comes, thoughts will well up in your mind, and you will devise a sinister scheme.

11.verse: You will say, “I am going to invade this land of unwalled villages; I will take by surprise these people who are at peace, living securely, all in places without walls, bars or gates.

12.verse: I will seize the spoil and take the plunder.” You will attack the former ruins that are now inhabited and come against the people gathered from the nations, who have acquired livestock and other wealth and are living in the central parts of the land.

13.verse: Sh’va, D’dan and all the leading merchants of Tarshish will ask you, “Have you come to seize spoil? Have you assembled your hordes to loot; to carry off silver, gold, livestock and other wealth; to take much plunder?”’

14.verse: “Therefore, human being, prophesy! Tell Gog that Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘Won’t you be aware of it when my people Isra’el are living in security?

15.verse: You will choose just that time to come from your place in the far reaches of the north, you and many peoples with you, all of them on horseback, a huge horde, a mighty army;

16.verse: and you will invade my people Isra’el like a cloud covering the land. This will be in the acharit-hayamim; and I will bring you against my land, so that the Goyim will know me when, before their eyes, I am set apart as holy through you, Gog.’

17.verse: “Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I spoke of you long ago through my servants the prophets of Isra’el. Back then, they prophesied for many years that I would have you invade them.

18.verse: When that day comes, when Gog invades the land of Isra’el,’ says Adonai ELOHIM, ‘my furious anger will boil up.

19.verse: In my jealousy, in my heated fury I speak: when that day comes there will be a great earthquake in the land of Isra’el;

20.verse: so that the fish in the sea, the birds in the air, the wild beasts, all the reptiles creeping on the ground and every human being there in the land will tremble before me. Mountains will fall, cliffs crumble and every wall crash to the ground.

21.verse: I will summon a sword against him throughout all my mountains,’ says Adonai ELOHIM; ‘every man will wield his sword against his brother.

22.verse: I will judge him with plague and with blood. I will cause torrential rain to fall on him, his troops and the many peoples with him, along with huge hailstones, fire and sulfur.

23.verse: I will show my greatness and holiness, making myself known in the sight of many nations; then they will know that I am ADONAI.’

1.verse: “So you, human being, prophesy against Gog; say that Adonai ELOHIM says: ‘I am against you, Gog, chief prince of Meshekh and Tuval.

2.verse: I will turn you around, lead you on and bring you from the far reaches of the north against the mountains of Isra’el.

3.verse: But then I will knock your bow out of your left hand and make your arrows drop from your right hand.

4.verse: You will fall on the mountains of Isra’el, you, your troops and all the peoples with you; I will give you to be eaten up by all kinds of birds of prey and by wild animals.

5.verse: You will fall in the open field, for I have spoken,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

6.verse: “‘I will also send fire against Magog and against those living securely in the coastlands; then they will know that I am ADONAI.

7.verse: I will make my holy name known among my people Isra’el; I will not allow my holy name to be profaned any longer. Then the Goyim will know that I am ADONAI, the Holy One in Isra’el.

8.verse: Yes, this is coming, and it will be done,’ says Adonai ELOHIM; ‘this is the day about which I have spoken.

9.verse: “‘Those living in Isra’el’s cities will go out and set fire to the weapons, to use as fuel — the shields, breastplates, bows, arrows, clubs and spears; they will use them for fire seven years;

10.verse: so that they will not need to gather wood from the fields or cut down any from the forests; because they will use the weapons for fire. Thus they will plunder those who plundered them and rob those who robbed them,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

11.verse: “‘When that day comes, I will give Gog a place there in Isra’el for graves, the Travelers’ Valley, east of the sea; and it will block the travelers’ passage. There they will bury Gog and all his horde, and they will rename it the Valley of Hamon-Gog [horde of Gog].

12.verse: It will take the house of Isra’el seven months to bury them, in order to cleanse the land.

13.verse: Yes, all the people of the land will be burying them; they will become famous for it. It will be a day for me to be glorified,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

14.verse: ‘They will then pick men for the continual duty of going through the land and burying with the travelers the corpses still lying out on the ground, in order to cleanse it; they will begin their search after the seven months.

15.verse: As they go through the land, if anyone sees a human bone, he will put a marker next to it until the gravediggers have buried it in the Valley of Hamon-Gog.

16.verse: Moreover, “Hamonah” [its horde] will be the name of a city. Thus will they cleanse the land.’

17.verse: “As for you, human, Adonai ELOHIM says that you are to speak to all kinds of birds and to every wild animal as follows: ‘Assemble yourselves and come, gather yourselves from all around for the sacrifice I am preparing for you, a great sacrifice on the mountains of Isra’el, where you can eat flesh and drink blood!

18.verse: You will eat the flesh of heroes and drink the blood of the earth’s princes — rams, lambs, goats and bulls, fattened in Bashan, all of them.

19.verse: You will eat fat till you are gorged and drink blood till you are drunk at the sacrifice I have prepared for you.

20.verse: At my table you will be satiated with horses, horsemen, heroes and every kind of warrior,’ says Adonai ELOHIM.

21.verse: “‘Thus will I display my glory among the nations, so that all the nations will see my judgment when I execute it and my hand when I lay it on them.

22.verse: From that day on, the house of Isra’el will know that I am ADONAI their God;

23.verse: while the Goyim will know that the house of Isra’el went into exile because of their guilt, because they broke faith with me; so that I hid my face from them and handed them over to their adversaries; and they fell by the sword, all of them.

24.verse: Yes, I treated them as their uncleanness and crimes deserved; and I hid my face from them.’

25.verse: “Therefore Adonai ELOHIM says this: ‘Now I will restore the fortunes of Ya‘akov and have compassion on the entire house of Isra’el, and I will be jealous for my holy name.

26.verse: They will bear their shame and all their [guilt from] breaking faith with me, once they are living securely in their land, with no one to make them afraid.

27.verse: This will be after I have brought them back from the peoples and gathered them out of their enemies’ lands, thereby being consecrated through them in the sight of many nations.

28.verse: Then they will know that I am ADONAI their God, since it was I who caused them to go into exile among the nations, and it was I who regathered them to their own land. I will leave none of them there any more,
